Posts.Content: Hello, I'm new here and testing my signature. Any suggestions would be of help. I'm pondering of continuing my plant based diet for another 3 months and do another PSA test before doing any biopsies. What do you guys think? Should I just do a biopsy ASAP? I am a bit scared since I'm somewhat young so this cancer could be highly aggressive and I will be fighting this forever. Even though it's not yet "100% official", I'm convinced that I have PC. My diet was pretty poor before.
Posts.Signature: Age 40 (I turn 41 September 2018 PSA: (Slightly Decreasing) 11/16/2017 7.3 01/25/2018 6.7 05/31/2018 Started Plant Based Diet 07/11/2018 6.1 (DRE ok) No Biopsy yet but trying to schedule MRI 8/1/2018: -No adenopathy seen -Prostate Volume 25cc -PI-RADS Assessment Category 4

Posts.Title: New to Board

Posts.Content: Thanks all. My first PSA test was included with my general yearly check up. I guess my doctor decided to include it since I was 40. The first two PSA test was from the same lab but the second test was strictly PSA test only. Third PSA was a different lab from my Urologist clinic. My Urologist is recommending a biopsy. I guess there is really no point of waiting, plant based or not. No family history but I urinate very often. And no sign of infection. I'm so glad I found this site.
